verses.verse: On the Day 1 after the Sabbaths, Mary (the Magdalene) comes to the burial vault in the morning, it still being dark, and sees the stone that has been taken away from the burial vault.
So she runs and comes to Simon Peter and to the other student whom Jesus kept being fond of. And she says to them, "They took the Master from the burial vault, and we don't know where they put Him."
So Peter and the other student went out and were going to the burial vault.
The two were running at the same time. And the other student ran ahead faster than Peter and came first to the burial vault.
And when he stooped and peered in, he sees the linen strips lying there; however, he did not go in.
So Simon Peter comes following him. And he went into the burial vault and sees the linen strips lying there
and the towel that was on His head, not lying with the linen strips, but separate from them, having been wound up into one place.
So at that time, the other student, the one who came first, also went into the burial vault, looked, and trusted.
You see, they didn't yet realize the Old Testament writing that says it is necessary for Him to come back to life from the dead.
So the students went off again to their own places.
But Mary had stood close to the burial vault crying outside. So as she was crying, she stooped and peered into the burial vault,
and she sees two angels in white seated, one near the head and one near the feet, where the body of Jesus was lying.
And those angels say to her, "Ma'am, why are you crying?" She says to them, "Because they took my Master away and I don't know where they put Him."
And after she said these things, she turned to the things left behind, sees Jesus who has stood there, and didn't realize that it is Jesus.

Jesus says to her, "Ma'am, why are you crying? Who are you looking for?" That Mary thinking that He is the gardener says to Him, "Master, if you hauled Him off, tell me where you put Him, and I will take Him away."
Jesus says to her, "Mary." When that Mary turned, she says to Him, "Rabboni" (Great Rabbi), that is said in place of Teacher.
Jesus says to her, "Don't touch Me. You see, I have not yet stepped up to My Father. Travel off to My brothers, and tell them I am stepping up to My Father, your Father, My God, and your God."
Mary (the Magdalene) comes, reporting to the students that she had seen the Master and He said these things to her.

So being evening on that day, the Day 1 after the Sabbaths, and the doors having been closed where the students were gathered together because of the fear of the Jewish people, Jesus went, stood in the middle, and says to them, "Peace to you."
And when He said this, He showed them His hands and His side. So the students were happy when they saw the Master.
So Jesus said to them again, "Peace to you. Just as the Father has sent Me out on a mission, I am also sending you."
And when He said this, He puffed on them and says to them, "Receive the Sacred Spirit.
If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven to them. If you hold on to the sins of any, they have been held on to."
But Thomas, one from among the Twelve, the one being called Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.

So the other students were saying to him, "We have seen the Master." But Thomas said to them, "Unless I see the impression of the spikes in His hands, put my finger into the impression of the spikes, and put my hand into His side, I won't in any way trust."
And after eight days, again His students were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus comes, the doors having been closed, stood in the middle, and said, "Peace to you."
After that He says to Thomas, "Bring your finger here, and see My hands. And bring your hand and put it into My side. And don't become untrusting, but become trusting."
And Thomas answered and said to Him, "My Master and My God."
Jesus says to Him, "Because you have seen Me, Thomas, you have trusted. The people who do not see and yet trust are blessed."
So Jesus also certainly did many other indicators in the sight of His students, that have not been written in this scroll.
These things have been written so that you might trust that Jesus is the Anointed King, the Son of God, and so that as you trust, you may have life in His name.
